title: Emmerdale dedicates episode to Zoe Tate actress Leah Bracknell in tribute after her death
text:

Emmerdale paid tribute to late Zoe Tate actress Leah Bracknell on Thursday, a day on from the announcement she had died.

The soap dedicated the latest two episodes to the fan favourite who died aged 55 in September, while her death was confirmed by her manager on Wednesday.

Just before the first of two episodes aired on ITV on Thursday night, the announcer paid tribute to the actress and revealed the latest episodes were dedicated in her memory.

They said: "Tonight's episodes of Emmerdale are dedicated to Leah Bracknell, who played Zoe Tate."

Then at the end of the second episode, a photo was aired of the late actress again paying tribute.

Fans welcomed the tribute to the star, following the devastating news of her passing three years on from her terminal diagnosis.

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

One fan said: "Wonderful tonight's episodes of #Emmerdale @emmerdale are dedicated to Leah Bracknell who played Zoe Tate. A fine actress & #LGBTQ icon. She was the first lesbian character in a British Soap. According to cast. One of the kindest & most lovely person you could meet. RIP."

Another agreed: "Tonight's episodes are dedicated to Leah Bracknell the great Zoe Tate r.i,.p Leah... Lovely from @emmerdale #Emmerdale ."

A third added: "What a beautiful touch dedicating tonight’s episodes to Leah Bracknell."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Emmerdale released a statement shortly after the news broke of her passing, reading: "Everyone on Emmerdale is very sad to hear of the death of Leah Bracknell.

“She was a hugely popular member of the Emmerdale cast for over 16 years. Leah was a very generous and caring colleague, much loved by cast and crew alike.”

Leah's manager initially broke the news, confirming: "It is with the deepest sadness that Leah Bracknell's family confirm that Leah passed away in September, three years after her diagnosis with stage 4 lung cancer.

(Image: Twitter)

"They would like to thank all the public for their support and generosity which contributed to the extension and quality of her life over the past three years.

"Leah continued to embrace life and faced her illness with positivity. Many aspects of her journey can be found on her blog.

"Leah was best known and much loved as Zoe Tate in Emmerdale. She also had roles in Judge John Deed, A Touch of Frost, The Royal Today and DCI Banks to name just a few, as well as numerous appearances on stage and in pantomime.

(Image: Leah Bracknell/Instagram)

"As well as acting, Leah was also an accomplished yoga teacher and shamanic healer. Leah had an energy and enthusiasm for life, a kind heart and much love to give to those around her.

"Her family have asked for privacy at this very sad time."

Emmerdale airs weeknights at 7pm on ITV, with an extra episode on Thursdays at 8pm.
description: Former Emmerdale star Leah Bracknell passed away after a battle with lung cancer, with fans and co-stars paying tribute
